intro: Psittacanthus gracilipes, commonly known as the slender-leaf sterculia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
